Presidents.Name: George Washington
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First President of the United States.

Presidents.Name: John Adams
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Second President of the United States.

Presidents.Name: Thomas Jefferson
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Principal author of the Declaration of Independence.

Presidents.Name: James Madison
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Father of the Constitution.

Presidents.Name: James Monroe
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Last president who was a Founding Father.

Presidents.Name: John Quincy Adams
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Son of John Adams, sixth President of the United States.

Presidents.Name: Andrew Jackson
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Founder of the Democratic Party and modern political campaigning.

Presidents.Name: Martin Van Buren
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First President born as a citizen of the United States, not a British subject.

Presidents.Name: William Henry Harrison
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Served the shortest term in U.S. presidential history.

Presidents.Name: John Tyler
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First Vice President to become President due to the death of the President.

Presidents.Name: James K. Polk
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Led the U.S. during the Mexican-American War.

Presidents.Name: Zachary Taylor
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Died in office, making his term one of the shortest in U.S. presidential history.

Presidents.Name: Millard Fillmore
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Last Whig to be President of the United States.

Presidents.Name: Franklin Pierce
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Signed the Kansas-Nebraska Act, which exacerbated sectional tensions.

Presidents.Name: James Buchanan
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Only bachelor President and served immediately prior to the American Civil War.

Presidents.Name: Abraham Lincoln
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Led the nation through the Civil War; Emancipation Proclamation; assassinated in office.

Presidents.Name: Andrew Johnson
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First President to be impeached.

Presidents.Name: Ulysses S. Grant
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Commanding general who led the Union to victory in the Civil War.

Presidents.Name: Rutherford B. Hayes
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Ended Reconstruction in the Southern States.

Presidents.Name: James A. Garfield
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Assassinated in office, serving only six months.

Presidents.Name: Chester A. Arthur
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Took office after the assassination of President Garfield.

Presidents.Name: Grover Cleveland
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Only President to serve two non-consecutive terms (22nd and 24th President).

Presidents.Name: Benjamin Harrison
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Grandson of President William Henry Harrison.

Presidents.Name: William McKinley
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Led the nation during the Spanish-American War; assassinated in office.

Presidents.Name: Theodore Roosevelt
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Known for his vigorous lifestyle, Progressive credentials, and 'Big Stick' diplomacy.

Presidents.Name: William Howard Taft
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Later served as Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court.

Presidents.Name: Woodrow Wilson
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Led the United States during World War I and was a key figure in the League of Nations.

Presidents.Name: Warren G. Harding
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Presidency was marred by many scandals, including Teapot Dome.

Presidents.Name: Calvin Coolidge
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Known for his quiet and frugal demeanor; presided over 1920s prosperity.

Presidents.Name: Herbert Hoover
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Presidency dominated by the onset of the Great Depression.

Presidents.Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Only president elected to four terms; led the U.S. during the Great Depression and World War II.

Presidents.Name: Harry S. Truman
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Ended World War II after dropping atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

Presidents.Name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Forces in Europe during World War II.

Presidents.Name: John F. Kennedy
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Promoted the Space Race; assassinated in office.

Presidents.Name: Lyndon B. Johnson
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Signed the Civil Rights Act and the Voting Rights Act into law.

Presidents.Name: Richard Nixon
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First president to resign from office, due to the Watergate scandal.

Presidents.Name: Gerald Ford
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Only person to have served as both vice president and president without being elected to either office.

Presidents.Name: Jimmy Carter
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Nobel Peace Prize laureate; known for his post-presidency humanitarian efforts.

Presidents.Name: Ronald Reagan
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Former actor and Governor of California; known for his economic policies known as 'Reaganomics'.

Presidents.Name: George H. W. Bush
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Led the U.S. during the end of the Cold War and the Gulf War.

Presidents.Name: Bill Clinton
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Second president to be impeached, but was acquitted by the Senate.

Presidents.Name: George W. Bush
Presidents.ImportantInformation: President during the September 11 attacks and initiated the Iraq War.

Presidents.Name: Barack Obama
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First African American president of the United States; signed the Affordable Care Act.

Presidents.Name: Donald Trump
Presidents.ImportantInformation: First president with no prior military or governmental service; impeached twice.

Presidents.Name: Joe Biden
Presidents.ImportantInformation: Oldest president at inauguration; vice president under Barack Obama.
